Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom fonts didn't work on Android 7" (#1376) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Follow this  [document](https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/android/application_fundamentals/resources_in_android/fonts/) to use a custom font as a resources
2. Deploy on Android 7
3. 

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
1. It should display the custom font on Android 7.
2. The document said we need use this line in TextView 
`app:fontFamily="@font/caveat_bold"`
### Actual Behavior
1. It can display the custom font on Android 8, but not Android 7.
2. I got `No resource identifier found for attribute 'fontFamily' in package 'com.xamconsulting.TestFont'` error, when I add `app:fontFamily="@font/caveat_bold"` into TextView

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add java-interop.jar to the Xamarin.Android install set" (#1375) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The [Android Designer currently has it's own copy of many of our core types](https://github.com/xamarin/md-addins/commit/4bd9fe7a04cbf95348a5a1f34f6c14023fb90b5f), which means if we alter this set of core types, things break.

`java-interop.jar`, part of the Java.Interop build, already contains many of these types.

We should update the Xamarin.Android SDK build to install `java-interop.jar`, and ensure that *all* types which the Android Designer requires are within that file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] The "ConvertResourcesCases" task failed unexpectedly." (#1371) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
DevDiv Issue 571365

We have a report that `ConvertResourcesCases` is failing with the follow
error.

	error MSB4018: The "ConvertResourcesCases" task failed unexpectedly.
	Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(1334,2): error MSB4018: System.IO.FileNotFoundException: <some path>/design_layout_snackbar.xml.tmp does not exist

This is completely weird, especially as the Task is not called in
parallel. What I susepct is happening is VSForMac is running is
UpdateResources task at the same time the user is doing a build.

Because the name of the temp files we are just `foo.xml.tmp` it
is highly possible that one instance of the task is deleting the
file while the other instance is still running. This is difficult
to replicate.

This change uses

	System.IO.Path.GetFileName (System.IO.Path.GetTempFileName ());

to generate a random temp file name for the temp file. This should
stop filename collisions.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Error: "java.exe" exited with code 1 in Release mode" (#1369) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open up any Xamarin.Android project
2. Change Solution Configuration to Release mode
3. Try to build the solution

### Expected Behavior
Successful build.

### Actual Behavior
I got this error
> "java.exe" exited with code 1.

### Version Information
I'm using VS 2017, v 15.6

> Xamarin   4.9.0.749 (9b0fce36d)
Xamarin Designer   4.10.58 (cee1369d0)
Xamarin.Android SDK   8.2.0.15 (HEAD/22d97e153)

I tired following:
1. Updating Proguard to latest version
2. Updating JDK (jdk1.8.0_162), but downgrade to 161 again
3. Set 1G as Java max heap size

I'm using Support library v4 and v7, Picaso, CallygraphyXamarin and JSON.net

In Debug mode I can build and archive the solution without any problem.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] ThirdPartyNotices.txt and $(CONFIGURATIONS)" (#1367) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
An unanticipated side-effect of commit 2bd13c4a was that
`make prepare` was downloading `bundle-v*.zip` for *both*
[Debug and Release][0] configurations, even on the PR builder (which
only builds Debug by default):

[0]: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android-pr-builder/2610/console

	Downloading `https://xamjenkinsartifact.azureedge.net/xamarin-android/xamarin-android/bin/Debug/bundle-v21-h86de098f-Debug-Darwin-libzip=1d8b1ac,llvm=bdb3a11,mono=607cbde.zip` to `/Users/builder/android-archives/.bundle-v21-h86de098f-Debug-Darwin-libzip=1d8b1ac,llvm=bdb3a11,mono=607cbde.zip.download`
	...
	Downloading `https://xamjenkinsartifact.azureedge.net/xamarin-android/xamarin-android/bin/Release/bundle-v21-h86de098f-Release-Darwin-libzip=1d8b1ac,llvm=bdb3a11,mono=607cbde.zip` to `/Users/builder/android-archives/.bundle-v21-h86de098f-Release-Darwin-libzip=1d8b1ac,llvm=bdb3a11,mono=607cbde.zip.download`.

This is unneccessary, but was a result of:

	$(foreach c, $(CONFIGURATIONS), \
	  $(eval $(call CREATE_THIRD_PARTY_NOTICES ...)))

Since `ThirdPartyNotices.csproj` has a `@(ProjectReference)` to
`xa-prep-tasks.csproj`, the build of which attempts to download the
bundle, simply executing `ThirdPartyNotices.csproj` was triggering a
bundle download, which is not desired.

Rework the dependencies so that by default we only create
`bin/$(CONFIGURATION)/lib/xamarin.android/ThirdPartyNotices.txt`, not
one for all `$(CONFIGURATIONS)`, and move the `$(CONFIGURATIONS)`
logic into `make leeroy-all`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ItemsSource CollectionChanged (Reset) Clears Picker SelectedItem" (#2032) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
If a Picker's ItemsSource raises a CollectionChanged event, and the NotifyCollectionChangedAction is Reset, the Picker's SelectedItem will be cleared out. 

**_Yes_**, even if none of the items in the ItemsSource have removed.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Clone this repo: https://ChristianFindlay@bitbucket.org/ChristianFindlay/xamarin-forms-scratch.git
2. Run the sample in UWP mode
3. Click the button labelled "Picker Issue"
4. Click the Reset button
5. Notice the SelectedItem is cleared out (nulled out). This shouldn't happen because none of the items in the ItemsSource have been removed.

### Expected Behavior
SelectedItem does not change

### Actual Behavior
SelectedItem is cleared out (nulled out)

### Basic Information
A Reset action from CollectionChanged in and of itself should not affect the SelectedItem. It should only affect the SelectedItem if the SelectedItem has been removed from the ItemsSource - e.g. if it is completely cleared. I haven't tested on other platforms but my guess is that the behavior will be the same.

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- Last known good version: ?
- IDE: VS 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - UWP:  16299 
  - Probably all platforms
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms

### Screenshots
https://www.dropbox.com/s/bimhdc9knj404pu/Before.png?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/kdwfycdyjpkk70e/After.png?dl=0

### Reproduction Link
https://ChristianFindlay@bitbucket.org/ChristianFindlay/xamarin-forms-scratch.git

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[CSS] Allow `class` as a shorthand for `StyleClass`" (#2022) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Some might find it intuitive to write
```xml
<Label x:Name="foo" class="description" Text="Bar" />
```

instead of
```xml
<Label x:Name="foo" StyleClass="description" Text="Bar" />
```

To avoid additional confusion and risks, `class` should be a passthrough property to `StyleClass` on `VisualElement`. While we're at it, why not deprecate `StyleClass` ?

## Risks
 - confusion possible with `x:Class` in XAML,
 - confusion with `class` in code, requiring to escape it `@class`,
 - a property starting with a lowercase,
 - possibility to set both, and get inconsistent results

Merged pull request "[backport][security] Strongly typed key generation (#3502)" (#3676) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
* [security] Modifying structure of bindings

Added strong dictionary for key generation according to
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/security/certificate_key_and_trust_services/keys/key_generation_attributes
in preparation making a strongly typed key generation possible.

* Making strong dictionary and composite of other strong dictionaries.

* Implementing access control as property type of SecPublicPrivateKeyAttrs.

* Adding new overload for SecKey.CreateRandomKey.

* Moving TokenID to strongly typed property.

* Fix coding style + use nameof

* Fixing Xcode version assertion of key generation tests.

* Fixing errors in test case.

* Fixing whitespace issue.

* Resolving inheritance issue

Removing inheritance between SecKeyGenerationParameters and
SecPublicPrivateKeyAttrs and instead add the necessary properties
to SecKeyGenerationParameters. Adds redundant code, but I don't
see a way around it.

* Moving test case to appropriate test class.

* Creating necessary strong dictionaries for key generation.

* [formatting] Mono coding guidelines

Make sure you're following http://www.mono-project.com/community/contributing/coding-guidelines/
In VSMac: Preferences > Source Code > Code Formatting > C# source code > Policy Mono.

* Remove [Advice] that are specific to GenerateKeyPair

`SecKeyGenerationParameters` and `SecKeyParameters` cannot be used for `GenerateKeyPair`.

* Clarify 'ArgumentException' for invalid 'SecKeyType'

* Fixed CreateRandomKeyTest

- Renamed CreateRandomKeyWithParametersTests to CreateRandomKeyTest.
- Add messages to all asserts.

```
keyGenerationParameters = new SecKeyGenerationParameters ();
keyGenerationParameters.KeyType = SecKeyType.Invalid;
Assert.Throws<ArgumentException> (() => { SecKey.CreateRandomKey (keyGenerationParameters, out _); }, "CreateRandomKey - invalid key type");
```
- ^ didn't work because `SecKeyGenerationParameters`'s setter protects against invalid. There's no constant for invalid so null is returned.

```
Assert.That (SecKey.CreateRandomKey (keyGenerationParameters, out _), Is.EqualTo (SecStatusCode.Param), "CreateRandomKey - Param issue, invalid RSA key size");
```
- ^ `SecKey.CreateRandomKey` doesn't return a `SecStatusCode` like `GenerateKeyPair`.

* Fixes based on spouliot's input.

* Mono styling fix.
